subject: Web3
title: Open vs. Closed Metaverses
description: A quick, practical guide to Open vs. Closed Metaverses.

hook.text: Should the metaverse be owned by corporations or built by communities? This debate defines Web3's vision.

buildup.text: Closed metaverses like Roblox and Fortnite are owned by companies. They control the rules, the economy, and the data.

discovery.text: Open metaverses like Decentraland run on blockchains. Users own the land, set the rules, and govern the world.

twist.text: Closed metaverses have millions of users. Open metaverses have better principles but a tiny fraction of the audience.

climax.text: The tension between corporate control and community ownership will determine what kind of digital world we build.

punchline.text: Corporate metaverses have the users. Open ones have the ideals.

quiz.question: What defines an open metaverse?
options: Users own assets and govern the world on blockchain infrastructure
